title: How Many Calories Are in Hot Chocolate?
meta_description: Learn how many calories are in hot chocolate for a standard 8 oz serving, plus full nutrition facts including carbs, protein, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Hot Chocolate?
assumptions: Standard 8 oz (240 ml) serving prepared with whole milk, 1 tbsp cocoa powder, and 1 tbsp sugar; no toppings like whipped cream.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by milk type, brand of cocoa, added sweeteners, and preparation method. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: A standard cup of hot chocolate contains about 190 kcal and 8 g protein.

Use unsweetened cocoa and no sugar

faqs.q: How many calories are in hot chocolate?
faqs.a: A standard 8 oz cup has about 190 calories.

faqs.q: Is hot chocolate high in sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 23 g of sugars per cup from milk and added sweeteners.

faqs.q: How does milk type affect calories in hot chocolate?
faqs.a: Whole milk adds more fat and calories; skim or plant-based milks reduce it by 30-50 kcal per cup.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in hot chocolate?
faqs.a: About 25 g per cup, mostly from sugars and minimal fiber (2 g).

faqs.q: Can I make low-calorie hot chocolate?
faqs.a: Yes, use unsweetened cocoa, low-fat milk, and a sugar substitute to drop calories to under 100 per cup.
